Mom And Kids Animal Kingdom
  • On Apr 13, 2012
    Melanie from SC Asked Note: This answer was provided prior to the change to planDisney and may still contain references to Disney Parks Moms Panel.

    Hi, I need some logistics help. We are staying at the Hilton on Disney property. My husband wants to take the ferry into Magic Kingdom like we did ages ago when we parked our own car. Is this possible to catch the ferry from the Hilton transportation??

    Hi Melanie!

        That is just sooo sweet!  I love that your husband is so nostalgic!!!  You are in luck, because the Hilton bus will drop you off at the Ticket and Transportation Center, where you will have one of two choices to get to the Magic Kingdom.  The fist choice is the monorail and the second is... you guessed it, the ferry boat! 

         I hope that you have a wonderful vacation and I would love to hear from you again!

    Much pixie dust,

    Jackie S.

Asked by Paul Mangold from U.S.A. | Feb. 08, 2012 20:02
About:China Embassy in Vietnam

Can a U.S. citizen apply in Vietnam for a Chinese visa to be used 4 months later?

I am a U.S. citizen working in South Korea. I would like to visit China in August, but my ARC card will have expired by that time. I will be in Vietnam in March. What is the best way to obtain a Chinese visa if my ARC card has less than 6 months left on it?

Answers (1)
Answered by Tyler from USA | Feb. 09, 2012 01:25
You can't apply for China visa in Vietnam, a single entry visa is valid for 3 months, when you travel to China in August, your visa obtained in Vietnam has expired. Please apply for a visa about one month in advance of your intended date of entry into China, and do not apply 3 months earlier than your intended date of entry into China.

It is also impossible for you to get a China visa in Korea if your ARC card has less than 6 months remaining validity.

You can first travel to Hong Kong or Macau to get a China visa, then go to Mainland China.

Mom and Dad planning vacation
  • On Jul 13, 2019
    Whitney from QC Asked Note: This answer was provided prior to the change to planDisney and may still contain references to Disney Parks Moms Panel.

    I made a dining reservation and it is not showing up on My Disney Experience. I have the confirmation number, and I get an error that does not allow me to link it to myself. How can I check if the reservation does indeed still exist? Thanks.

    Hello again Whitney, 

    Welcome back to the Disney Parks Moms Panel and thank you for asking us another question. It’s always great to see you!

    The answer to your question depends on the type of error that you’re getting when you’re trying to link your Disney dining reservation to your My Disney Experience account. If the error says to try again later, then it might be a system issue. I can usually resolve those by switching internet browsers, devices (if you’re using the mobile app) or even going into “incognito mode” or “private” mode on my browser. 

    If none of those options works or the error message says that your reservation can’t be found, your best bet would be to contact Walt Disney World Resort and see what the issue is. They’re always happy to help “untangle” your vacation plans!

    I sincerely hope that this is the only technical issue that you’ll experience when planning your upcoming visit to Walt Disney World Resort. Please don’t hesitate to come back and see us if you have any other questions, technical or otherwise!

    Have a Magical Day, 

thumbnail image for Lynne

How Can I get from Heraklion Port to Bali?

by Ruth

Hi, I've been told that ferries can sometimes be delayed and because we are going to arrive from Santorini quite late, I was a bit worried about how could we get to our hotel in Bali.

Buses seem to finish around 9pm or 10pm. Is there any other option apart from taxis? Any idea how much could this ride cost?

Thank you!

From Santorini to Bali Beaches in Rethymnon Crete

Hi Ruth,

There is a pre-booked transfer service available which will give good peace of mind. The service can meet your ferry and will be informed if the ferry is delayed. The transfer can then take you to your hotel in Bali.

You have a few choices of transport on this route...Of course, the sea always has the last word with ferry crossings, and for safety reasons the trip may be delayed.

The fast ferries from Santorini (Thira) to Heraklion in Crete run May to October and depart 5.30 pm arriving 7.15 pm. This is Hellenic Seaways service.

From June to October, the TeraJet leaves Santorini at 5.20 pm and arrives to Heraklion at 6.55 pm, this is run by SeaJet service.

From April to October, the MegaJet leaves Santorini at 5.30 pm and gets to Rethymnon at 8.00 pm, this is also run by SeaJet ferries.

See our page about Santorini to Crete (and return) here...

More information for Getting Around in Crete including taxis and pre-arranged transfers.

See info for pre-booked transfers here at Taxi Reservations...

For up to 4 people from Heraklion to Bali, shows a cost of around 60 Euro if pickup is around 7.15 pm.

For up to 4 people from Rethymnon to Bali, shows a cost of around 66 Euro if pickup is around 8.00 pm.

You can put in your Port and your destination area (Bali) or hotel name to see exactly how much it will be for your relevant date and time of day.

The coves of Bali are five beautiful beaches on the north coast of Crete, 34 km from Rethymnon town, with clear waters perfect for snorkelling or diving. Protected by the peninsula, these calm waters are great for families or just relaxing, inland are mountains to explore. A popular hiking area is Mount Kouloukonas.

Hire a car or take the local bus to visit Rethymnon town, explore its old town with narrow lane ways and beautiful Venetian architecture. There are the old port, the lighthouse and the fortezza to visit, and the atmospheric plazas and museums.

Bon Voyage! Kalo Taxidi!

questions & answers: itinerary check

tokyo, osaka, kobe, kyoto

Tokyo, osaka, kobe, kyoto

Hi, we plan to visit Japan this 2015 July. We are family of 4. First visit to Japan.
This will be our itinerary. Is it worth it to buy the 7 days Japan rail pass? Also, how easy is it to travel to the stations from hotels? Also, are all the trains bullet train? Thank you.


Hello there,

The JR Pass would be worth it if you return to Tokyo after Kyoto, if you stay in Kyoto then it would be better to buy normal tickets.

It depends on the hotel of course, however public transport in Japan is very good and it should not take too long to get there.

Not all trains in Japan are bullet trains, however Tokyo, Osaka, Kobe and Kyoto all have a bullet train station.

Hope this helps,


If this is your first trip, I would suggest that you stay close to the stations. There are many comfortable and affordable hotels at and close to all railway stations. Plus JR pass not only allows you unlimited travel on certain bullet trains but also unlimited travels on JR trains which is an alternative to metro or underground ( especially in Tokyo ).


Order your Japan Rail Pass Online

Starting from $254.00 for 7 days of unlimited Japan Rail travel

Travelling to India while H1 transfer is in RFE

0 votes
Hi everyone,

Here is my case, please help me.

I am currently in US  and my visa is expired in november 2016. My visa is filed by company A and I797 extension is also filed and now, I797 is valid till 2019.

I filed for H1b transfer to company B and currently it is in RFE state.  I haven't joined company B yet.  Now i am planning to travel to india due to family emergency.

Can i travel with my old visa and get it stamped with company A's I797 (Valid till 2019) and hold my transfer till i return to US? will this create any problem?

Please help.

Thank you.
asked Dec 13, 2016 in H1B Visa by Rohit45718 (160 points)

1 Answer

0 votes
Hello Everyone,

I myself found an answer to this question with personal experience.

Yes, I could get my visa stamped with Employer A's petition. No questions were asked about H1 transfer and RFE.

But if you travel to India, the H1 transfer will be treated as void as the i94 number changes, you have to withdraw the H1 transfer and file a new H1 when you return.

answered Mar 20 by Rohit45718 (160 points)

Family With Medals
  • On Feb 13, 2013
    Rbyn Asked

    Hello, We will be WDW March 2-9, How difficult is the traveling between resorts? and how is the crowds and weather?

    Welcome back to the Moms Panel Robyn!  The beginning of March is a wonderful time to visit Walt Disney World, from my experience.  While there are a few schools that break that early, most have not, so you should find the crowd levels to be quite manageable.  The weather is usually very nice - in the high 70's or low 80's during the day.  I would suggest checking a reliable website, like, just prior to your visit so you will have a better idea of expected weather conditions for your trip.

    To travel between resorts you will need to catch a bus from your resort to Downtown Disney or one of the theme parks and transfer to the bus for the resort you wish to travel to.  This could take up to one hour, depending on frequency of buses and resort location.

    Thanks for asking your question at the Disney Parks Moms Panel.  I hope you have a sunny, fun-filled vacation at Walt Disney World!
